content.description: This is a scary, difficult to link problem. Nine days of work ,a bloody nose and a sprained ankle. Hard bouldery sequence down low followed by some easy stuff in the middle followed by another boulder problem 20 feet off the deck. SDS on the insane pinch/rail in lowest Hueco. The line links the two big huecos then goes Left a little to a mantle then back right and tips out at Highest point. Awesome holds.
content.protection: Three pads to bridge the rock. Full Highball with a dicey landing.
content.location: Follow the directions to get to skagits.

content.description: Awesome line right on the way to Hatfields and McCoys.  Climb the obvious arÃªte from a stand start on jugs.   Work up through some nice crosses  to the big ear for the top out.   Some questionable hollow flakes up top. Not a hard problem but really enjoyable movement. Couple other boulders   Right there.
content.location: Follow the directions to skagits area. Cluster of three boulders is uphill to the left as the trail meanders along the edge of the swamp. 3 minutes from end of 4x4 road.

content.description: An awesomely featured gneiss wall with crazy huecos and pinches in a beautiful and extremely remote location.  There are some boulders on your left on the walk in but the wall is the most special.
